sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Good morning, Europe. It's Thursday, the 23rd of December.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Let's take a look at the latest headlines.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Blanket booster programs are likely to prolong the pandemic rather than ending it.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: No country can boost its way out of the pandemic, the WHO says, as it warns of the dangers of vaccine inequity.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: With Omicron infections rising across Europe, Belgium and Spain issue fresh advice on how to celebrate Christmas as safely as possible.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: And EU leaders call for a return to the negotiating table over tensions between Russia and Ukraine, insisting diplomacy is key.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: No country can boost its way out of the pandemic.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: This was the stark warning from the Director General of the World Health Organisation as further countries battled the Omicron variant.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Dr Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus acknowledged that vaccine supply is increasing, but access to jabs in lower-income countries is still problematic.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: He added that there were enough vaccines administered globally this year that every country could have inoculated 40 per cent of its population.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: However, inequality in distribution and hoarding are preventing the pandemic from coming to an end. While some countries are now rolling out blanket booster programs, only half of WHO's member states have been able to reach the target of vaccinating 40% of their populations by the end of the year because of distortions in global supply. The WHO Strategic Advisory Group of Experts on Immunization, or SAGE, is issuing an interim statement on booster doses. SAGE concluded that the focus of immunization must remain on decreasing deaths and severe diseases and expressed concern that blanket booster programs will exacerbate vaccine inequity. About 20% of all vaccine doses administered every day are currently being given as boosters or additional doses. Blanket booster programs are likely to prolong the pandemic rather than ending it.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Nigeria has destroyed some 1 million expired doses of AstraZeneca.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: The coronavirus vaccines were disposed of at a landfill site in the capital, Abuja.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: vaccines were disposed of at a landfill site in the capital Abuja. The move comes as the West African nation says it will no longer accept COVID vaccine donations with short shelf lives.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: While the jab uptake has almost doubled in the West African nation in the last week, only 2% of the population are fully inoculated. Several EU countries are re-imposing COVID-19 restrictions to protect people during Christmas

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: as the Omicron variant spreads around the continent.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: In Belgium, Prime Minister Alexandre Ducru has said that concert halls, cinemas and other venues will have to close from this weekend. We can celebrate Christmas together, but I remind you to do so with the greatest possible caution.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Limit the number of people around the table.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Do not gather in large groups.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Do a self-test before celebrating Christmas together.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Ventilate into your spaces as much as possible.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: In Spain, the mandatory use of face masks outdoors has been reintroduced.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Spanish Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez said the army will be helping with vaccination efforts.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The most important measure to tackle this phase of the pandemic is to intensify and accelerate the vaccination process with the emphasis on the third dose in order to help the work of health professionals we will reinforce 150 mobile vaccination teams with members of the armed forces but protesters took to the streets of barcelona to contest the latest measures they held up banners dismissing the restrictions and vaccines.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Libertà! Libertà! Libertà!

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: While in Europe some resist vaccines, in the US health regulators have approved a Covid pill in the hope to slow down infection rates. Made by Pfizer, the drug, which is expected to be effective against Omicron, has shown promising results with high efficacy and low side effects.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: On the Russian border, Ukrainian troops go through manoeuvres in preparation for what the country thinks is a coming invasion from the east.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Although Russia denies any plans for aggression, Italian Prime Minister Mario Draghi suggested a European army would discourage an attack.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: What is the deterrence factor the European Union has?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: We have to reflect about it, because have we missiles, ships, cannons, armies?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Not at the moment.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile, Germany's new foreign minister, Annalena Baerbock, took a more diplomatic stance, saying that sit-down talks were the best way to calm tensions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: ANNALENA BAERBOCK, German Foreign Minister I've repeatedly said how important it is that we return to the negotiating table in the Normandy format to ensure that we can avert a further escalation because this major crisis we are in can only be resolved through dialogue." In a phone call on Wednesday, Baerbock's sentiments were echoed by the heads of the American and European diplomatic services, Antony Blinken and Joseph Borrell, who agreed that any possible solution will have to be done through diplomacy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Russia's Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov remains open for further dialogue.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: And in a show of support, Poland's Foreign Minister met with his Ukrainian counterpart to discuss the current situation on the Russian border.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The European Commission wants multinational companies to pay a minimum tax of 15 percent.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: In line with the agreement at the OECD, the Brussels proposal comes after the global agreement of 137 countries.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: It will apply to companies with revenues of more than 750 million euros per year and that have a parent company or a subsidiary based in an EU member state.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Minimum taxation will bring additional revenue to EU member states that have seen their tax takes depleted by low-tax jurisdictions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: In the medium term, part of this additional revenue will likely decrease as low tax for countries will increase their tax rates precisely because of the effective mechanism of this Pillar 2.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Ireland, Hungary and Estonia weren't too keen on the agreement at first, as they have low corporation tax rates.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: For the MEP Paul Tang, it still remains a sensitive issue.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: We must realise that there is also a call, for example from the European Parliament, to raise the minimum effective tax rate.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: That 15% is not enough. That you need to tax capital income at the same rate as labour income. So in that sense I very much hope for a new round of OECD negotiations in the future that will raise the minimum effective corporate tax rate.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: For NGOs, the proposal is unambitious and it might lead to a shortage of EU resources for Covid-19 recovery.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The proposal still has to be discussed at the Council and at the Parliament. shortage of EU resources for Covid-19 recovery.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The proposal still has to be discussed at the Council and at the Parliament.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: For the first time in four years, all four faces of London's Big Ben will be fully visible to ring in the new year.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Scaffolding that has surrounded Elizabeth Tower and the Great Clock for renovation work since 2017 is gradually being removed.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: I think it's fantastically important.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: It's important for the tourist industry, it's important for us.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: It's an international symbol, international symbol of democracy and remember of course the bell, Big Ben itself was the only bell allowed to ring during the Second World War.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: So that was the sound of liberty and hope.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: As the clock strikes midnight on the 31st, the bells will also chime for the last time using a temporary system.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: The original 11.5 ton Victoria-era mechanism will be put in its original place at the beginning of the year, after it was removed for its protection.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: The complete restoration is expected to be finished by summer.
